result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Lopez Herrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony, Conspire to Manufacture/Deliver Drugs], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.
  • Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.67(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay court costs, costs of extended supervision, victim/witness surcharges, etc during term of confinement, at the rate of 25% of all prison funds.
Defendant to pay court costs, costs of extended supervision, victim/witness surcharges, etc during term of confinement, at the rate of 25% of all prison funds.

records.addlTxt: 3 years

Anthony Lopez Herrera, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Philip J. Brehm.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Court reviews case. Pre-sentence investigation has been received. No errors or omissions. No witnesses. State gives recomendation. Defense counsel makes arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court reviews report. Court sentences defendant (see attached Minutes Sheet)
Cover letter
Letter from counselor

Anthony Lopez Herrera, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Philip J. Brehm.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Sentencing hearing rescheduled for location of document.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.
PSI to Attorneys
Amended Signature Bond Signed on 2-20-17 at counter by Anthony Lopez Herrera.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Lopez Herrera
Current: 202 Mifflin St, Cobb, WI 53526 United States  (Effective: 02-02-2017)
Prior: 202 Mifflin St, Cobb, WI 53526 United States

Violation: Conspiracy to commit manufacture of meth, possession of waste from meth manufacture, purchase of pseudophedrine product 5 cts
Issuing Agency: Monroe Police Department
Conditions: May not leave state of Wisconsin or the counties of Green, Iowa, Grant, or Lafayette without permission of Court.
  May not possess or consume any controlled substances, including Schedule 5  Pseudoephedrine unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant, and methamphetamine or components including:
   Lithium, lithium batteries, lye, Coleman fuel/white gas, drain cleaner, sodium chloride.
  May go to the residence one time to pick up personal belongings if accompanied by an officer, once the property is released by authorities.
Defendant to notify Clerk of Courts office of any change of address within 48 hours.

Anthony Lopez Herrera, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Philip J. Brehm.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Amended information has been tendered. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2 of the amended information. Other counts are dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes. Pre-sentencing investigation is requested. Defendant to remain free until sentencing date, as he is employed.
